name: Condom Promotion and Distribution.
description: Counseling on condom use and availability of condoms

name: VCT-Voluntary Counseling and Testing
description: Counseling and testing which is client initiated

name: PITC-Provider-Initiated Counseling and Testing
description: Counseling and testing as a result of encouragement by the providers

name: DCT-Diagnostic Counseling and Testing
description: Testing of suspected disease in order to make a diagnosis

name: HEI - HIV exposed infants
description: Availability of Dry Blood Spot kits

category: PMTCT-Prevention of Mother to Child  Transmission of HIV
name: Counselling on  best  breastfeeding and complementary feeding practices  in HIV, Highly Active Anti retroviral Therapy, Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis, ARV prophylaxis for children born of HIV+ mothers
description: Provision for HIV counseling and testing for pregnant mothers at either ANC or within the Maternity and post natal clinics

name: VMMC-Voluntary Medical Male Circumcision Services
description: A programme of circumcising adult males in order to reduce HIV transmission

name: Post-Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP)
description: Counseling, testing, and administration of PEP drugs.

name: Management of Sexually Transmitted Illness (STI)
description: Availability of Information, Education and Communication (IEC) materials, diagnosis facilities, treatment guidelines, and drugsManagement of sexually transmitted Infections, Pelvic Inflammatory Disease management, Post Exposure Prophylaxis, Condom distribution/ provision, HIV Testing and Counselling (HTC)

category: HIV prevention and treatment of malnutrition
name: Nutrition assessment ,councelling and support ( The NACS process) for PLHIVs
description: Availability of anthropometric equipment, IEC materials, Councelling cards  Nutrition and HIV guidelines, tool kit for service providers,  caretaker booklet, drug nutrient interaction charts,( Chart A and B ) and therapeutic and supplemental feeds  for provision of nutrition services via the NACS process.

name: Basic  Maternity Obstetric Care (BMOC)
description: Basic Maternity obstetric (and newborn care), provided in Health facilities

name: Comprehensive Maternity Obstetric Care (CMOC)
description: Comprehensive Maternity obstetric (and newborn) care, for the management of life-threatening obstetric complications

name: Short Term:
description: Pills, injectables, condoms, and

name: Long term:
description: Intra-Uterine Contraceptive Device (IUCD), implants

name: Natural
description: Counseling, cycle beads

name: Permanent:
description: Vasectomy, bilateral tubal ligation (BTL)

name: Focused Antenatal Care (FANC)
description: care given to pregnant mothers with at least four ANC visits within the same pregnancy.

name: Specialised ANC
description: care given to pregnant mothers  within the same pregnancy and must have a medical doctor. This is care given to pregnant women with high risk pregnancy

category: Services for Gender- Based- Violence Survivors
name: Basic Services for Gender- Based- Violence Survivors
description: Treatment of physical injuries, sexually transmitted diseases prophylaxis, three days of PEP with ARVs, emergency contraception, testing for HIV and counseling and psychological counseling. Availability of Post-Rape Care forms/ P3 forms

category: Services for Gender- Based- Violence Survivors
name: Comprehensive Services for Gender- Based- Violence Survivors
description: Basic  Services for Gender- Based- Violence Survivors  plus forensic services specimen analysis. High vaginal swab, HIV testing and DNA testing, theatre services

name: Integrated Services
description: Services to the youth offered alongside other services

name: Stand-alone Services
description: Separate building (Youth Centre) with provision of outpatient services, comprehensive Reproductive Health package, and should have recreational facilities, e.g. games etc.

name: Basic Immunisation:
description: Children less than two  years vaccinated with WHO prequlified  immunization  vaccines  as per Kenya EPI immunization schedule (BCG, OPV bith dose, OPV1,2,3/IPV, DPT+ HIB+Hep B, 1,2,3 ,PCV 1,2,3, Rota 1,2 and Measles 1,2 and Yellow fever in selected sub county

name: Basic Immunisation: for Pregnant women
description: Pregnant women receiving  2 doses of TT vaccines   during first pregnancy followed by  additional 3rd to 5th doses of TT during subsequent pregnancies.                 (Please note that TT trauma doses are  captured under workload report and TT cards  as doses used to boost immunne system the use of TT card is however very low)

name: Basic
description: Vaccination services given to travellers; vaccines include yellow fever, meningococcal meningitis vaccine, etc.

name: Comprehensive
description:
Basic services and Monitoring of people movement in relation to International Health Regulations
Monitoring of imported and exported commodities affecting public health

name: Basic IMCI
description: management of acute respiratory infections (ARI), diarrhoea, pneumonia, measles, malaria  malnutrition and Deworming among others

name: Comprehensive IMCI
description: Basic IMCI plus ETAT (emergency assessment and triaging) inpatient services with resuscitation services and inpatient services

name: Basic  new born care Care
description: Basic new born care  provided in Health facilities

name: Comprehensive emergency new born care Care
description: Comprehensive  newborn care, for the management of life-threatening new born complications

name: Smear Microscopy:
description: Availability of a laboratory doing AFB smear and microscopy

name: Tuberculosis Culture:
description: Facility has a laboratory that does culture for TB diagnosis and may also diagnose Multi Drug Resistant TB (MDRTB) through Drug Susceptibility Test (DST)

name: Tuberculosis Treatment:
description: Availability of medicines for treating new and re-treatment cases (Rifampicin, Isoniazid, Pyrazinamide, Ethambutol, and Streptomycin) in the facility

name: Multi-Drug Resistant Tuberculosis Treatment:
description: Availability of second-line drugs (as per national MDRTB guidelines) in the facility with staff are trained on MDRTB management

name: Satellite Blood Transfusion service
description: Collect, storageand distribution of blood within their catchment area

name: Facility offering Blood Transfusion Service
description: Safe administration of blood and blood products to patients and record keeping.

name: General  Radiography Services
description: Emergency x-rays, skull x-rays, spine x rays, chest x-ray, abdominal x-ray, pelvic x ray, extremity x-rays (musculo-skeletal)

name: Specialised  Radiography Services
description: Barium swallow, Barium meal, IVU, HSG, CT.

name: Obstetric ultrasound
description: General obstetric scans, Advanced obstetric scans

name: General Abdominal scans
description: Liver, Spleen,Kidneys, Pancrease, Gastrointestinal tract, Retroperitoneum, Suprarenal glands, urinary bladder, gall bladder

name: Small parts
description: Scrotum, Thyroid gland, breast

name: Gynaecological scans
description:
Pelvic scan to demonstrate •Abnormal periods or bleeding
•Pelvic pain
•To assess a lump that has been found such fibroids or ovarian cysts
•Polycystic ovaries
•Infertility
•Post-menopausal bleeding
•To check for coil position

name: Cardiac ultrasound (1)-Structural
description:
Structural imaging of the pericardium (eg, to exclude pericardial effusion)
• Structural imaging of the left or right ventricle and their cavities (eg, to evaluate ventricular hypertrophy, dilatation, or wall motion abnormality; to visualize thrombi) 
• Structural imaging of the valve for mitral stenosis, aortic stenosis, mitral valve prolapse; 
• Structural imaging of the great vessels (eg, aortic dissection) 
• Structural imaging of atria and septa between cardiac chambers (eg, congenital heart disease, traumatic heart disease; see the second image below)

name: Cardiac ultrasound (2) Haemodynamic
description:
Imaging of blood flow through heart valves (eg, valvular stenosis and regurgitation; see the image below) 
• Imaging of blood flow through the cardiac chambers (eg, cardiac output calculation, assessment of diastolic and systolic function of the heart) 
• Tissue Doppler imaging of heart structures.

name: Head
description: Brain tumour, orbital tumour, inflammation of brain meninges, aneurysm, haemorrages.

name: Spine
description: Reduced sensation, reduced reflexes, Muscle wasting, CNS tumour or inflammation, cord compression, myelopathy, post-surgical monitoring, trauma monitoring,

name: Abdomen
description: Liver lesions, placenta accreta/pacreta, planning for artery embolisation for fibroids, pre-operative evaluation of assessement  for inferior vena cava for known solid renal tumourrenal, perineal abcess/fistula, evaluation of MR urography, adrenal mass evaluation.

name: Musculoskeletal
description: Bone tumour. Bone infection . Spondylitis of sacroiliac joint. Osteonecrosis. Juvenile dermatomyositis. Gaucher's disease

name: Cardiovascular
description: Heart disease, carotid artery dse, vertabral artery dse, paediatric congenital anomalies

name: Breast
description: Breast cancer, invasive lobular carcinoma, rule out intracapsular implant rapture,

name: Body
description: Staging for cancer

name: Contrast enhanced
description: Procedures for conditions that require contrast enhancement

name: General x-ray examination
description: Reporting

name: Specialised x-ray examinations
description: Reporting /contrast enhanced

name: CT scans
description: Reporting /cotrast enhanced

name: MRI
description: Reporting /contrast enhanced

name: Fluoroscopy
description: Screening/reporting

name: Ultrasound
description: Scanning /reporting/Biopsy guiding/ contrast enhanced exams

name: Interventional Radiology
description: Interventional Procedures performed

name: Basic Emergency Preparedness
description: Basic Life Support (BLS), Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS), Trauma Life Support (ATLS), and Paediatrics Life Support (PALS) and Acute Psychological Support and Counseling

name: Comprehensive Emergency Preparedness
description: BLS, ACLS, ATLS and PALS and Acute Psychological Support and Counseling

name: Specialised Occupational Therapy
description: Pediatric Occupational Therapy

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Physical Rehabilitation

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Mental Health

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Occupational Health and Ergonomics

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Geriatric Occupational Therapy

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Low Vision Therapy

description: Hand Therapy

description: Driving and Community Mobility

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Sensory Integration Therapy

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Speech Therapy

description: Recreational Therapy

description: Burns and Plastic Surgery Rehabilitation

name: Basic Occupational Therapy
description: Club foot care
